physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Mild hepatosplenomegaly, bilateral pes cavus, externally rotated hips, genu valgus, hammertoes, decreased muscle tone, and mild foot drop. Reflexes were depressed in the upper extremities and absent in knees and ankles. Ophthalmologic evaluation revealed nystagmus, dysconjugate gaze, slowed, hypometric horizontal saccades, and decreased pupillary constriction (Adie-like). Nerve conduction studies showed 13 to 18 m/second in all extremities, consistent with a childhood demyelinating pattern.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Significant resolution of organomegaly following enzyme replacement therapy (Imiglucerase, 120 U/kg bi-weekly).
